wikipedia_page.main: Trevor Charles Bosworth Stamp, 4th Baron Stamp MD FRCP (born  18 September 1935) is a British medical doctor and hereditary peer.  He was consultant physician and director of the Department of Bone and Mineral Metabolism, Institute of Orthopaedics, at the Royal National Orthopaedic Hospital, 1974–1999, and has been honorary consultant physician (retired) since then.  He succeeded his father Trevor Stamp, 3rd Baron Stamp as Baron Stamp in 1987.  The House of Lords Act 1999 removed the right of hereditary peers to sit in the House of Lords.
